overview: From 2025-09-15 to 2025-09-16, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 9 new PRs (6 merged), 6 new issues, and 32 active contributors.

topIssues.title: load testing flashblocks on devnets
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
A load test should be performed on eris-0 to ensure that it's ready to be served publicly with the quality of service we're expecting from it.

During the window of this load tests:
- The normal block progression should meet 99.95% of our SLA.
- The flashblocks should meet 99% availability (availability represented by a 250ms stream of flashblocks available)

topIssues.title: Partner's support criteria evaluation on eris-0
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
Use eris-0's flashblocks enablement as a vehicle to test the following criteria:

- A Flashblock enabled sequencer is live on a 2 chain alphanet
   - Block production must meet a 99.95% SLA
   - Flashblocks streaming must meet a 90% SLA
- Fallback to normal sequencer when Flashblocks are not working is tested on a live network

topIssues.title: min-base-fee: add `minBaseFee` configuration variable to `SystemConfig` contract
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
A new method should be added

```solidity
function setMinBaseFeeLog2(uint8 minBaseFeeLog2) external onlyOwner;
```

which emits a `ConfigUpdate` event with a new `UpdateType`: `UpdateType.MINIMUM_BASE_FEE`.

See ratified design doc https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/295

topIssues.title: Implement Websockets support in the Kurtosis Reverse Proxy
topIssues.author: serpixel
topIssues.body:
<!--
Need help?
Refer to our contributing guidelines for additional information about making a good issue:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently websockets will not be reachable through the Traefik websocket proxy. This means we need to use a direct connection (as seen in #17172). We would want to use the reverse proxy to be consistent with the rest of services.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]
-->

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I had an initial stab at this, seems that upgrading to traefik v3 and using TCP routing would sort out the issue (but ended up breaking the rest of endpoints).
We're also using an old version of traefik (v2.10) which has a [known websockets issue](https://github.com/dani-garcia/vaultwarden/discussions/3516) so perhaps updating to the last version and doing some routing can also work.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
-->

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!--
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
-->

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
-->

topIssues.title: easy way to get the latest version numbers for OP Stack components
topIssues.author: tessr
topIssues.body:
It's not always clear what the latest or recommended versions of different OP Stack components (like `op-deployer`) are. This is partly due to confusion on the GH releases page:

1. search doesn't work
2. you can't have multiple "latest" releases (key for monorepos)
3. you can't separate the releases by package, it's just one huge blob (also key for monorepos)
4. prerelease stuff shows up alongside prod stuff

We discussed the possibility of creating something like releases.optimism.io which could display the latest version numbers for each component, but I was concerned about any security risks that this might introduced -- if this page were compromised, someone could redirect users to malicious releases. 

So instead @bitwiseguy had the idea to include a new recipe (`just latest-releases`) that would display the latest versions for each component in the OP Stack üëåüèº 

Once implemented, we should also add a line to [this page](https://docs.optimism.io/operators/chain-operators/tools/op-deployer) that encourages people to use the recipe instead of just saying "use the latest release" 

Other criteria:

* Should be updated automatically when new releases are created 
* Should cover key OP Stack components that live in the monorepo:
    * op-node
    * op-batcher
    * op-challenger
    * op-conductor
    * op-deployer
    * op-validator
    * op-txproxy
    * op-up
    * (I might be missing something)

topPRs.title: TimelockGuard add basic configuration functionality
topPRs.author: maurelian
topPRs.body:
**Description**

This is the first PR in a forthcoming stack (expect 1 or 2 more PRs), which establishes the outline of the TimelockGuard contract.

It fully implements and tests the following functions of the TimelockGuard listed in the [specs](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/761):

- `viewTimelockGuardConfiguration`
- `configureTimelockGuard`
- `clearTimelockGuard`
- `cancellationThreshold`

It also includes empty placeholders for the following functions: 
- `scheduleTransaction`
- `checkTransaction`
- `checkPendingTransactions`
- `rejectTransaction`
- `rejectTransactionWithSignature`
- `cancelTransaction`

This PR does not combine the TimelockGuard and LivenessModule2, that is done in #17402.

topPRs.title: Add minimal cancellation function relying on Safe logic
topPRs.author: maurelian

topPRs.title: proofs: Move proposer/challenger params on v2 contract
topPRs.author: mbaxter
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Move the `proposer` and `challenger` parameters from the `PermissionedDisputeGameV2` constructor to immutable arguments provided at initialization.

Builds on top of: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17290.

**Tests**

Update and add a few more unit tests. In particular, add some new tests that set invalid implementation arguments with additional or missing bytes for both FDGv2 and PDGv2.  

**Metadata**

Fixes https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17255

completedItems.title: justfile: add latest-versions recipe
completedItems.body:
# Overview
Creates a root level `just latest-versions` command which scans git tags, then returns the stable and latest tag for each component. 

Current output:
```
{
   ...
  "op-challenger": {
    "stable": "v1.5.2",
    "latest

completedItems.title: op-acceptance-tests: remove INITIAL_L2_BLOCK variable
completedItems.body:
This PR is removing `INITIAL_L2_BLOCK` variable and simplifying the op-node sync tests with external nodes.

Instead of using a hardcoded block number, we now fetch the latest block number from the EL node and use a target of 1000 blocks

completedItems.title: op-deployer: read addresses onchain instead of from chainConfig
completedItems.body: In preparation for removing some hardcoded addresses from the superchain-registry chainConfigs, this pr updates the `TestAddGameType` function to read addresses from onchain instead of from the static chainConfig.
